body:
@tinothy22 yes your val classification is overtraining fairly early on. We've seen this before when using pretrained weights, I'm not exactly sure why.

You could start from a backbone instead of fully pretrained weights, this might help:
`--weights darknet53.conv.74`

Also, you should train to at least 300 epochs. 50 will never produce optimal results.

@tinothy22 you could also play around with class label smoothing, by varying `eps` from 0.01 to 0.10 perhaps. This is intended to prevent classification overfitting.

https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/4ac60018f6e6c1e24b496485f126a660d9c793d8/utils/utils.py#L386-L388

I reused yolov3-tiny for training results and still overfit!
![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53636618/78888390-19833880-7a94-11ea-8988-e2fd3ecc3cb9.png)
I use eps=0.1 and it didn't get the effect.
![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53636618/78887922-4f73ed00-7a93-11ea-8aaf-7bc149f5a8ad.png)
I use yolov3-tiny.conv.15 and it still didn't work
![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53636618/78888051-8cd87a80-7a93-11ea-89ba-6f9b5a01e7af.png)

I am puzzled, I also tried the adam optimizer, multi-scale, etc. have no effect, is there something wrong with my dataset?My data set has only two classes, a total of 7959 pictures, and a training set of 6737 pictures

@tinothy22 it looks like everything is working fine. If you are looking for better mAP I'd recommend switching to yolov3-spp.cfg and training from scratch --weights '', or training using the default pretrained --weights yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt.
One thing I've noticed is that overtraining starts earlier when using pretrained weights, so if the val classification is increasing you should try instead training from scratch --weights ''.
@tinothy22 your validation losses are not increasing in your results.png, there is no overfitting.
@PointCloudNiphon you probably have nan values, check your results.txt.

@glenn-jocher Hello! My val losses are all very high during training. Is that normal? Maybe my test dataset is too small?(6557 images for train, 1311 images for test, my data are all chosen from coco 2017) 
The following results use pretrained yolov3.pt.  
![results_yolov3pre_change_lr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41316711/80444483-6c8a3600-8944-11ea-9668-5e51d1ae030f.png)
The following results are trained from scratch.
![results_yolov3scra](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41316711/80444858-58930400-8945-11ea-909a-08646b275dec.png)

@tyb197 see https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3#reproduce-our-results

I don't have a magic genie ball to declare your results either way, especially on a custom dataset I've never seen.
